thread.title: Hitting to all fields: On Super Bowl chances, and a date with Kent State
thread.title_full: Hitting to all fields: On Super Bowl chances, and a date with Kent State

author: Garry Brown | Special to The Republican
title: Hitting to all fields: On Super Bowl chances, and a date with Kent State
text:
Just sitting and wondering if Pats are on the Super highway. 
Give our Falcons another look, home Friday. 
Baseball's latest dynamic duo - Theo Epstein and Joe Maddon. 
UMass really needs this one against Kent State. 
News item: Jurgen Klinsmann drawing criticism as coach of U.S. men's soccer team. Will he make it to the next World Cup? 
Happy 75th birthday, Tommy Harper. 
Yikes - the 0-3 Bruins have allowed 16 goals. 
Springfield 35, Hobart 13. After trailing 13-0. 
Football surprise: West Side over Longmeadow. 
A two-round TKO did it for lightweight champ Terry Flanagan. 
In that loaded Toronto lineup, Kevin Pillar (.412) bats eighth. 
Mismatch of the week - Baylor 66, Kansas 7. 
South Hadley's Griffin Fitzell . . . wow. 
What? Ye Olde Handicapper's horse finished last - again? 
Baseball irony: Houston's Carlos Correa had four hits and four RBI, yet was the goat of a 9-6 playoff loss. 
You're getting old if you saw Paul Bellucci score soccer goals for Tech. 
Lynx over Fever? Yes, home court rules in WNBA Game 5. 
Number of the week: 441 (Passing yardage for Giants' QB Eli Manning in 30-27 victory over 49ers). The UMass hockey roster includes 12 Canadians and three Bay Staters. 
Oh-oh. BC has scored one TD over its last two games. 
Look who leads the NFL on defense - the New York Jets. 
Oct. 16, 1969: After losing opener to Orioles, underdog Mets win World Series in five games. Next for the Revolution - Saturday home match vs. Montreal (3-9-1 on the road). 
Venus the Labrador retriever balks at the vet's front door. 
News item: Novak Djokovic beats Rafael Nadal in China Open final. His eighth title of a memorable tennis year. 
Grandpa's a fan of Springfield's Public Schools Sports Hall of Fame. 
Good baseball reading: "Knuckleball," by Lew Freedman. 
Coming Sunday - Sunderland's 14-mile Mt. Toby Trail race. 
Honk if you saw Friday night football at Pynchon Park. 
Yes, 45 years since Chicago did "Colour My World." 
Watch Holyoke Community in women's soccer (9-4-2). 
Add Caprice Dydasco (women's pro soccer) to my list of favorite sports names. 
There'll never be another Jocelyn Guevremont. 
Garry Brown can be reached at geebrown1918@gmail.com
